ğŸ¤ BREAKING: GUYANA VOLUNTEERS AS AMERICA’S STORAGE UNIT ğŸ“Š QUICK STATS:
Countries Involved: 3+ (none of them asked)
Opposition Anger Level: ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥
Kaieteur News Caps Lock: MAXIMUMIn the wildest plot twist since the 2020 elections, Guyana is in productive discussions with the United States about accepting third country nationals.
Let That Sink In: America wants to deport people from OTHER countries to Guyana. Not Americans. Not even people who’ve ever BEEN to Guyana. Just random third-country nationals that America doesn’t want.
ğŸ—£ï¸ WHAT THE PAPERS SAID:
ğŸ“° Stabroek News: "Questions have been raised about constitutional implications..."
ğŸ“° Kaieteur News: "THE PEOPLE MUST KNOW!"
ğŸ“° Chronicle: "President Ali Praised By US!"
ğŸ“° Guyana Times: "Ten delegates ready for pageant!"
The Opposition Is BIG MAD: WIN and Forward Guyana are furious. The government says “but you guys made backroom deals when YOU were in power?” Everyone conveniently forgets.
The Real Story: Guyana watched Trump invade Venezuela, kidnap Maduro, and say “we’re keeping the oil.” Guyana’s response: “yes, we’d LOVE to be more involved!”
ğŸ’° THE MOHAMEDS: SEASON 2, EPISODE 47 âš–ï¸ THE MOHAMED APPEAL-O-METER âš–ï¸
Appeals Filed: 95%Courts Remaining: ğŸ›ï¸ (Maybe 1?)
Florida's Patience: â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘â–‘ 0%
The father-son duo filed YET ANOTHER appeal to the Full Court.
Their Legal Strategy: If at first you don’t succeed, appeal, appeal again.
BREAKING NEWS TICKER
ğŸš¨ "Mohameds not going anywhere" â†’ Court appearance scheduled ğŸš¨
What Kaieteur Has Written: 4,000+ articles. They turned this into a soap opera: Days of Our Extraditions.
ğŸŒ‰ HIGH STREET BRIDGE JOINS THE INFRASTRUCTURE HALL OF SHAME âš ï¸ INFRASTRUCTURE FAILURE ALERT âš ï¸
Status:CRACKED & SINKINGWeight Limit:10 tonnes (basically useless)Surprise Level:0% (we saw this coming)The bridge between Lamaha and Cowan Streets is cracked and sinking. Weight limit now 10 tonnes. The bridge designed for traffic can’t handle traffic.
ğŸ“‹ HOW INFRASTRUCTURE WORKS:
Elsewhere: Plan â†’ Build â†’ Maintain â†’ Use for decades âœ“
In Guyana: Plan (maybe) â†’ Build â†’ Celebrate â†’ Break â†’ Act surprised â†’ Repeat ğŸ”„
This Is The Same Country That: Built Heroes Highway with concrete in December 2023, announced asphalt overlay in January 2025 (13 months later).
ğŸ« 18 SCHOOLS TO BE COMMISSIONED ğŸ“ SCHOOL ANNOUNCEMENT PATTERN ğŸ“
âœ“ Year 1-4: Announce, construct, delayâ†’ Year 5 (Election Year): LOOK! 18 SCHOOLS!Government commissioning 18 schools by Q1 2026. Questions about teachers and Wi-Fi remain unanswered.
ğŸ† ACHIEVEMENT UNLOCKED:
Internet Didn't Crash For 20 Minutes!
The Digital School: Successfully held its first lesson where students logged into Zoom without the internet dying. That’s the achievement.
ğŸ“Š GRA DISCOVERS INTERNAL CONSPIRACY â•”â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•—
â•‘ IRONY LEVEL: MAXIMUM â˜¢ï¸ â•‘
â•šâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
â–ˆ Tax Collectors: Helping NOT pay taxes
â–ˆ Government: Shocked face
GRA found coordinated internal conspiracy. People at the tax-collecting agency were helping people NOT pay taxes. The irony is maximum.
ğŸ¯ YOUR DAILY RECAP ğŸ“ WHAT WE LEARNED:
Guyana accepting other people's deporteesThe Mohameds found another courtBridges are temporary infrastructure18 schools are "ready"Working internet = national achievementTax collectors can't be trustedğŸ”® TOMORROW'S FORECAST:

content:
About The Daily Laugh ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡¾ Welcome to The Daily Laugh - your daily satirical roundup of Guyana’s four major newspapers.
What We Do We read Stabroek News, Kaieteur News, Chronicle, and Guyana Times every day, then write funny commentary about the headlines. We’re not real journalists - we’re satirists who care about Guyana enough to mock its problems.
Meet CARIBSTAR Your editor and chief troublemaker. Strong opinions, questionable judgment, excellent coffee tolerance.
Contact Questions? Complaints? Want to tell us we’re hilarious or terrible? Drop us a line.
Email: caribbeandailybrief@gmail.com
This is satire. See our Legal Disclaimer for details.

Legal Disclaimer & Copyright Policy Last Updated: January 9, 2026
This Is Satire All content on The Daily Laugh is satirical commentary on Guyana news. We’re not journalists - we’re satirists.
Fair Use & Copyright We summarize news from Guyana’s four major newspapers under fair use principles:
We don’t republish full articles We add substantial original commentary We transform content into satire We attribute sources Not Defamation Our satire focuses on:
Public officials and their conduct Matters of public interest Political controversies Public policy We don’t target private citizens or make false accusations.
No Professional Advice This blog doesn’t provide legal, financial, or medical advice. Consult professionals for serious matters.
Contact Questions or complaints? Contact us at: caribbeandailybrief@gmail.com
Bottom Line: We’re satirists exercising free speech to comment on Guyana’s public affairs. We respect copyright and avoid defamation.
